Label: ISIS-2 Topside Sounder Ionogram over Syowa Base, Antartica (lat/lon=-69/40) - R.F. Benson (NASA GSFC)

DatasetLink.Title: ISIS/Alouette Topside Sounder Data Restoration Project site.

VariableDescription.Name: ampl
VariableDescription.LongDescription: Sounder amplitude at 223 virtual heights for fixed & swept frequency
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         ISIS>International Satellite for Ionosphere Studies
#                                     NSSDC>Archived Data
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Ionospheric Science
#     SOURCE_NAME                     ISIS-2>International Satellite for Ionosphere Studies 2
#     DATA_TYPE                       AV>Average Ionogram
#     DESCRIPTOR                      SYO>Syowa
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TITLE                           Topside Sounder Ionogram
#     TEXT                            A 7-track ISIS 2 analog telemetry tape from Ottawa (#561) has been
#                                     digitized using the GSFC facilities of the Data Evaluation Laboratory
#                                     (DEL) within the Mission Operations and Data Systems Directorate (Code
#                                     500) at Goddard.  The digitization was performed using an A/D
#                                     converter board and software device driver compatible with the OS/2
#                                     operating system used by the 486-based Programmable Telemetry
#                                     Processor (PTP) associated software has been installed on their PTP
#                                     and de-bugged so that we now have a working system for making digital
#                                     ISIS ionograms directly from the telemetry tapes.  Earlier, we
#                                     successfully digitized the PCM and NASA 36 bit time-code data from
#                                     this same tape. The ionograms were digitized at the rate of 40,000
#                                     16-bit samples/sec. This sample rate is higher than the Nyquist
#                                     frequency of 30 kHz appropriate for the post-detection ISIS 2
#                                     sounder-receiver video output which extends from DC to 15 kHz (see p.
#                                     50 of the 1971 ISIS 2 report by Daniels).  The sample frequency of 40
#                                     kHz provides a measurement every 25 microseconds corresponding to an
#                                     apparent range (ct/2) interval of 3.747 km.  With the ISIS 2 prf of 45
#                                     sounder pulses/s, there are (1/45)/(2.5**(-5)) = 888.89 samples
#                                     between each of the approximately 1015 sounder pulses per ionogram
#                                     (including the fixed-frequency portion) or nearly 10**6 16-bit
#                                     samples/ionogram (approximately 1.8 MBytes) for just the
#                                     sounder-receiver video data. Adding header information, and the pcm
#                                     data containing data from the other instruments, yields about 2 MBytes
#                                     of data for the 22.5 s period corresponding to one ionogram. Two steps
#                                     were taken in order to reduce this large volume of nearly 2
#                                     MBytes/ionogram.  First, every four 25 microsecond samples following
#                                     the sounder pulse were averaged.  Second, the 16 bit samples were
#                                     reduced to 8 bit samples.  The first step decreased the apparent-range
#                                     resolution to 15 km, but yielded high-quality ionograms because of the
#                                     improved S/N due to the averaging.
#     MODS                            created April 1995
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0110
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 I2_AV_SYO_yyyydddhhmmss_V01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  I2_AV_SYO
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      ISIS-2 Topside Sounder Ionogram over Syowa Base, Antartica (lat/lon=-69/40)
#     PI_NAME                         R.F. Benson
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  NASA GSFC
#     MISSION_GROUP                   ISIS
#                                     !___ITM Data including Earth Imaging and Ground-Based
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Imaging and Remote Sensing (ITM/Earth)
#     NSSDC_ID                        spio-00208
#     ALT_LOGICAL_SOURCE              ISIS2_Topside-Sounder_Ionogram-Averages-SYO-69S040E_0.03sec_cdf
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Time
#  2. Sounder amplitude at 223 virtual heights for fixed & swept frequency
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 20:06:46 2015

VariableDescription.Name: freq
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         ISIS>International Satellite for Ionosphere Studies
#                                     NSSDC>Archived Data
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Ionospheric Science
#     SOURCE_NAME                     ISIS-2>International Satellite for Ionosphere Studies 2
#     DATA_TYPE                       AV>Average Ionogram
#     DESCRIPTOR                      SYO>Syowa
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TITLE                           Topside Sounder Ionogram
#     TEXT                            A 7-track ISIS 2 analog telemetry tape from Ottawa (#561) has been
#                                     digitized using the GSFC facilities of the Data Evaluation Laboratory
#                                     (DEL) within the Mission Operations and Data Systems Directorate (Code
#                                     500) at Goddard.  The digitization was performed using an A/D
#                                     converter board and software device driver compatible with the OS/2
#                                     operating system used by the 486-based Programmable Telemetry
#                                     Processor (PTP) associated software has been installed on their PTP
#                                     and de-bugged so that we now have a working system for making digital
#                                     ISIS ionograms directly from the telemetry tapes.  Earlier, we
#                                     successfully digitized the PCM and NASA 36 bit time-code data from
#                                     this same tape. The ionograms were digitized at the rate of 40,000
#                                     16-bit samples/sec. This sample rate is higher than the Nyquist
#                                     frequency of 30 kHz appropriate for the post-detection ISIS 2
#                                     sounder-receiver video output which extends from DC to 15 kHz (see p.
#                                     50 of the 1971 ISIS 2 report by Daniels).  The sample frequency of 40
#                                     kHz provides a measurement every 25 microseconds corresponding to an
#                                     apparent range (ct/2) interval of 3.747 km.  With the ISIS 2 prf of 45
#                                     sounder pulses/s, there are (1/45)/(2.5**(-5)) = 888.89 samples
#                                     between each of the approximately 1015 sounder pulses per ionogram
#                                     (including the fixed-frequency portion) or nearly 10**6 16-bit
#                                     samples/ionogram (approximately 1.8 MBytes) for just the
#                                     sounder-receiver video data. Adding header information, and the pcm
#                                     data containing data from the other instruments, yields about 2 MBytes
#                                     of data for the 22.5 s period corresponding to one ionogram. Two steps
#                                     were taken in order to reduce this large volume of nearly 2
#                                     MBytes/ionogram.  First, every four 25 microsecond samples following
#                                     the sounder pulse were averaged.  Second, the 16 bit samples were
#                                     reduced to 8 bit samples.  The first step decreased the apparent-range
#                                     resolution to 15 km, but yielded high-quality ionograms because of the
#                                     improved S/N due to the averaging.
#     MODS                            created April 1995
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0110
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 I2_AV_SYO_yyyydddhhmmss_V01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  I2_AV_SYO
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      ISIS-2 Topside Sounder Ionogram over Syowa Base, Antartica (lat/lon=-69/40)
#     PI_NAME                         R.F. Benson
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  NASA GSFC
#     MISSION_GROUP                   ISIS
#                                     !___ITM Data including Earth Imaging and Ground-Based
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Imaging and Remote Sensing (ITM/Earth)
#     NSSDC_ID                        spio-00208
#     ALT_LOGICAL_SOURCE              ISIS2_Topside-Sounder_Ionogram-Averages-SYO-69S040E_0.03sec_cdf
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Time
#  2. Interpolated fixed & sweep frequencies
#       NOTES:  This variable could be used as x-axis on amplitude spectrograms if fixed part is subtracted.
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 20:06:49 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#       NOTES:  This variable could be used as x-axis on amplitude spectrograms if fixed part is subtracted.
#
EPOCH                       FREQUENCY

#     DATA_TYPE                       AV>Average Ionogram
#     DESCRIPTOR                      SYO>Syowa

#     TEXT                            A 7-track ISIS 2 analog telemetry tape from Ottawa (#561) has been
#                                     digitized using the GSFC facilities of the Data Evaluation Laboratory
#                                     (DEL) within the Mission Operations and Data Systems Directorate (Code
#                                     500) at Goddard.  The digitization was performed using an A/D
#                                     converter board and software device driver compatible with the OS/2
#                                     operating system used by the 486-based Programmable Telemetry
#                                     Processor (PTP) associated software has been installed on their PTP
#                                     and de-bugged so that we now have a working system for making digital
#                                     ISIS ionograms directly from the telemetry tapes.  Earlier, we
#                                     successfully digitized the PCM and NASA 36 bit time-code data from
#                                     this same tape. The ionograms were digitized at the rate of 40,000
#                                     16-bit samples/sec. This sample rate is higher than the Nyquist
#                                     frequency of 30 kHz appropriate for the post-detection ISIS 2
#                                     sounder-receiver video output which extends from DC to 15 kHz (see p.
#                                     50 of the 1971 ISIS 2 report by Daniels).  The sample frequency of 40
#                                     kHz provides a measurement every 25 microseconds corresponding to an
#                                     apparent range (ct/2) interval of 3.747 km.  With the ISIS 2 prf of 45
#                                     sounder pulses/s, there are (1/45)/(2.5**(-5)) = 888.89 samples
#                                     between each of the approximately 1015 sounder pulses per ionogram
#                                     (including the fixed-frequency portion) or nearly 10**6 16-bit
#                                     samples/ionogram (approximately 1.8 MBytes) for just the
#                                     sounder-receiver video data. Adding header information, and the pcm
#                                     data containing data from the other instruments, yields about 2 MBytes
#                                     of data for the 22.5 s period corresponding to one ionogram. Two steps
#                                     were taken in order to reduce this large volume of nearly 2
#                                     MBytes/ionogram.  First, every four 25 microsecond samples following
#                                     the sounder pulse were averaged.  Second, the 16 bit samples were
#                                     reduced to 8 bit samples.  The first step decreased the apparent-range
#                                     resolution to 15 km, but yielded high-quality ionograms because of the
#                                     improved S/N due to the averaging.
#     MODS                            created April 1995
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0110
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 I2_AV_SYO_yyyydddhhmmss_V01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  I2_AV_SYO
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      ISIS-2 Topside Sounder Ionogram over Syowa Base, Antartica (lat/lon=-69/40)
#     PI_NAME                         R.F. Benson
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  NASA GSFC
#     MISSION_GROUP                   ISIS
#                                     !___ITM Data including Earth Imaging and Ground-Based
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Imaging and Remote Sensing (ITM/Earth)
#     NSSDC_ID                        spio-00208
#     ALT_LOGICAL_SOURCE              ISIS2_Topside-Sounder_Ionogram-Averages-SYO-69S040E_0.03sec_cdf
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Time
#  2. Altitude
#       NOTES:  Virtual variable.
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 20:06:50 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#       NOTES:  Virtual variable.
#
EPOCH                   SATELLITE_ALTITUDE
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms                  km
03-02-1973 05:49:37.138            1400.60

VariableDescription.Name: FH
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         ISIS>International Satellite for Ionosphere Studies
#                                     NSSDC>Archived Data
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Ionospheric Science
#     SOURCE_NAME                     ISIS-2>International Satellite for Ionosphere Studies 2
#     DATA_TYPE                       AV>Average Ionogram
#     DESCRIPTOR                      SYO>Syowa
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TITLE                           Topside Sounder Ionogram
#     TEXT                            A 7-track ISIS 2 analog telemetry tape from Ottawa (#561) has been
#                                     digitized using the GSFC facilities of the Data Evaluation Laboratory
#                                     (DEL) within the Mission Operations and Data Systems Directorate (Code
#                                     500) at Goddard.  The digitization was performed using an A/D
#                                     converter board and software device driver compatible with the OS/2
#                                     operating system used by the 486-based Programmable Telemetry
#                                     Processor (PTP) associated software has been installed on their PTP
#                                     and de-bugged so that we now have a working system for making digital
#                                     ISIS ionograms directly from the telemetry tapes.  Earlier, we
#                                     successfully digitized the PCM and NASA 36 bit time-code data from
#                                     this same tape. The ionograms were digitized at the rate of 40,000
#                                     16-bit samples/sec. This sample rate is higher than the Nyquist
#                                     frequency of 30 kHz appropriate for the post-detection ISIS 2
#                                     sounder-receiver video output which extends from DC to 15 kHz (see p.
#                                     50 of the 1971 ISIS 2 report by Daniels).  The sample frequency of 40
#                                     kHz provides a measurement every 25 microseconds corresponding to an
#                                     apparent range (ct/2) interval of 3.747 km.  With the ISIS 2 prf of 45
#                                     sounder pulses/s, there are (1/45)/(2.5**(-5)) = 888.89 samples
#                                     between each of the approximately 1015 sounder pulses per ionogram
#                                     (including the fixed-frequency portion) or nearly 10**6 16-bit
#                                     samples/ionogram (approximately 1.8 MBytes) for just the
#                                     sounder-receiver video data. Adding header information, and the pcm
#                                     data containing data from the other instruments, yields about 2 MBytes
#                                     of data for the 22.5 s period corresponding to one ionogram. Two steps
#                                     were taken in order to reduce this large volume of nearly 2
#                                     MBytes/ionogram.  First, every four 25 microsecond samples following
#                                     the sounder pulse were averaged.  Second, the 16 bit samples were
#                                     reduced to 8 bit samples.  The first step decreased the apparent-range
#                                     resolution to 15 km, but yielded high-quality ionograms because of the
#                                     improved S/N due to the averaging.
#     MODS                            created April 1995
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0110
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 I2_AV_SYO_yyyydddhhmmss_V01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  I2_AV_SYO
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      ISIS-2 Topside Sounder Ionogram over Syowa Base, Antartica (lat/lon=-69/40)
#     PI_NAME                         R.F. Benson
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  NASA GSFC
#     MISSION_GROUP                   ISIS
#                                     !___ITM Data including Earth Imaging and Ground-Based
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Imaging and Remote Sensing (ITM/Earth)
#     NSSDC_ID                        spio-00208
#     ALT_LOGICAL_SOURCE              ISIS2_Topside-Sounder_Ionogram-Averages-SYO-69S040E_0.03sec_cdf
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Time
#  2. Electron Gyrofrequency
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 20:06:50 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#  2. Electron Gyrofrequency
#
